div.l: Was noon so hardi that went by the way
That with hir durst onys rage or play
But if he wolde be slayn of Symkyn
With panade or with knyf or boydekyn
For Ielous folk ben ꝑperiolous euere mo
Algate thei wolde her wyues wenden so
And ek for she was somdel smoterlich
She was as digne as water in a dich
As ful of hoker and of bismare
Hir thought that a lady shulde hir spare
What for hir kynrede and hir nortelrie
That she hadde lerned in the Nonnerie
A doughter hadde thei bitwixe hem two
Of twenty ȝere withouten ony mo
Sauyng a child that was of halfhalhalf ȝere age
In cradel it lay and was a ꝓproper page
This wenche thik and wel growen was
With camuse nose and eyen grey as glas
With buttokes brode and brestis rounde and hye
But right faire was hir her͗e I wil nouȝt lye
The ꝑpersoun of the toun for she was so fair
In purpos was to make hir his air
Bothe of his catel and his messuage
And strange he made it of hir mariage
His pᵘurpos was for to bistowe hir hye
Into som worthi blood of Auncetrye
For holy chirches good moot ben dispendid
On holy chirche blood that is descendid
Therfore he wolde his hooly blood honoure
Though that he hooly chirche shulde deuoure
Gret soken hath this meller oute of doute
With whete and malt of al the land aboute
And namelich ther was a gret college
Men clepen the soler halle at Cantabregge
Ther was her whete and ek her malt groıı̄unde
And on a day it happide in a stounde
